lead_paragraph: BRUCE--Dr. Thomas. Dr. Thomas Allen Bruce, was born in 1930 in Mountain Home, AR, son of Floyd and Dora (Fee) Bruce. Dr. Bruce died peacefully on March 4, 2016 at his home in Little Rock, AR. He will be remembered as a physician and academic leader, having served as Dean of the University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences (UAMS) College of Medicine and as Inaugural Dean (Dean pro tem) of the UAMS College of Public Health and of the University of Arkansas Clinton School of Public Service. He also was well known as a philanthropist, having served for many years as Program Director at the W. K. Kellogg Foundation in Battle Creek, MI, and on the adjunct staff at the Arkansas Community Foundation. He was preceded in death by his wife, Dolores (Montgomery). He is survived by his sister, Carolyn Porter of Santa Ynez, CA, and by two children, Thomas K. M. Bruce and wife Kelly of Niles, MI, and Dana (Bruce) Thomas and husband Tim of Little Rock, as well as four grandchildren: Bruce A. Thomas, A. Wendy Thomas, Christopher A. Thomas, and Amy I. A. Bruce. A concert is scheduled on April 24 in honor of Dr. Bruce and the remarkable life he lived. Details and online guestbook please visit: rollerfuneralhomes.com/ chenal. In lieu of flowers, contributions can be made to Heifer International, Watershed Community Service Agency, Wildwood Academy of Music and the Arts, or the UAMS Dr. Thomas A. Bruce Endowment in Public Health and Public Service. 1/3
